entry.title: BIP 8.5: Flag day activation based on nlocktime signaling
entry.summary: Dave's communication highlights a critical aspect of proposal evaluation within the Bitcoin development community, specifically addressing the issue of redundancy and the need for innovation. He points out that the concept under discussion has been proposed multiple times in the past, as evidenced by references to discussions on the subject from April and May 2017, April 2022, and June 2013. These references are accessible through links to the Linux Foundation's Bitcoin development mailing list archives: [April 2017](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2017-April/014193.html), [May 2017](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2017-May/014321.html), [April 2022](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2022-April/020344.html), and [June 2013](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2013-June/002729.html). By directing attention to these previous discussions, Dave underscores the importance of distinguishing new proposals from existing ones not just in terms of content but also regarding their potential contributions to the field. He implicitly encourages the proposer to clarify how their suggestion offers unique value or improvements over past ideas, thereby fostering a culture of meaningful innovation and progress within the Bitcoin development community.
